intro: Stanleya tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly phlox, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features hairy, gray-green foliage and produces showy clusters of pink to purple flowers in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Stanleya tomentosa thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open meadows and woodland edges.
